itemtemplate.name: %name% of Retribution
itemtemplate.text:
The metal of this blade is forged in the dust of celestials, with a hilt wrapped in fiend skin leather. The eye of a dragon is placed upon the hilt and polished in monster blood. When you use this magic weapon to attack a creature and roll a 20 on the d20 for the attack roll, you can cast Divine Smite as part of the same action used to make the attack without expending a spell slot.
Crafting. Creating a Blade of Retribution requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Dust] Celestial Dust • [Fluid] Monster Blood • [Hide] Skin from a Fiend • [Organ] Eye from a Dragon
itemtemplate.source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 383 (Third Party)

itemtemplate.name: Champion's %name%
itemtemplate.text:
Attack rolls made using this magic weapon can score a Critical Hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
Crafting. Creating a Champion's Weapon requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:
• [Animus] Any • [Bones| Bones • [Fluid] Sap • [Hide] Plates
itemtemplate.source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 383 (Third Party)

itemtemplate.name: Crimson %name%
itemtemplate.text:
A blood-red ichor drips down this sword's darkened steel blade. The sword is coated in sanguine witch blood. The dust of dead vampires is forged into the steel of the blade, giving it its blackened sheen. The edge is then empowered by the heart of a dragon. Its gold hilt wrapped in crimson leathers and a bloodred ruby plucked from the corpse of a Sanguine Witch. The fangs of vampires decorate the pommel. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic sword Any a creature you hit with this weapon that isn't a Construct or Undead takes an extra 3d6 Necrotic damage, and you regain Hit Points equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.
Curse. While attuned to this blade, you can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of its occupants.
Crafting. Creating a Crimson Blade requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components:
• [Animus] Undead Animus from a Sanguine Witch • [Dust] Undead Dust from any Vampire • [Fluid] Monster Blood from an Undead • [Natural Weapons] Teeth from any Vampire • [Organ] Heart from a Dragon
itemtemplate.source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 384 (Third Party)

itemtemplate.name: Dazing %name%
itemtemplate.text:
This hammer is made from giant bones and forged in undead dust. The bones are then stained with monster blood. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this magic hammer. When you score a Critical Hit with this hammer, the target is Dazed until the start of your next turn.
Crafting. Creating a Dazing Hammer requires an Uncommon Workshop and the following Uncommon Components:
• [Animus] Any • [Bones] Skull from a Giant • [Dust] Undead Dust • [Fluid] Monster Blood
itemtemplate.source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 384 (Third Party)

itemtemplate.name: Frozen %name%
itemtemplate.text:
This armor channels cold energy through carefully manufactured veins of elemental fluid that run along the inside of its frame. Elemental dust is mixed with the gold in its forming, and contaminated ichor is used as a catalyst to magnify the magical effects. The animus gem placed centrally upon it must be infused with the energy of a frost giant. While attuned to this armor you have Resistance to Cold damage and are Immune to the Frozen condition. This magical armor has six charges, and regains all expended charges each day at dawn. When you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your Reaction and expend 1 charge from the armor to freeze your attacker in pace. The creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be Frozen (DC 15).
Crafting. Creating Frozen Armor requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Animus from a Frost Giant • [Dust] Elemental Dust • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid
itemtemplate.source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 384 (Third Party)

itemtemplate.name: %name% of Chaos
itemtemplate.text:
A hammer of chaos is crafted by melting down the magical plates of otherworldly constructs, infused with both the fluid and dust of elementals. The weapon is then soaked in the grey matter of an aberrant brain. This steel hammer is fitted into a shaft made from fiend skin leather and the ribs of a dragon. You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this weapon. This hammer has the Thrown property with a normal range of 30 feet and a long range of 90 feet. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, choose Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, or Thunder. The hammer deals 2d8 extra damage of the chosen type. When you hit with a ranged attack using this weapon, if you roll the same number on two or more of the d8s, the hammer ricochets to a different target of your choice within 30 feet of the target. Make an attack roll against the new target, and make a new damage roll if the attack hits. After making this attack, the hammer flies back to your hand.
Crafting. Creating the Hammer of Chaos requires a Legendary Workshop and the following Legendary Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Bones] Spine from a Dragon • [Dust] Elemental Dust • [Fluid] Elemental Fluid • [Hide] Plates from a Construct • [Hide] Skin from a Fiend • [Organ] Brain from an Aberration
itemtemplate.source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 387 (Third Party)

itemtemplate.name: Inexhaustible %name%
itemtemplate.detail: very rare (requires attunement by a fighter)
itemtemplate.text:
This armor is made from fey leathers and magical plates, infused with the chemical solutions found in some constructs and empowered with the heart of a gorgon. While attuned to this armor, you gain an additional use of your Second Wind class feature. In addition, when you use your Second Wind, you regain an additional 3d6 Hit Points and can remove one of the following conditions from yourself: Blinded, Charmed, Dazed, Deafened, Frightened, Immobilized, Poisoned, Slowed, or Staggered.
Crafting. Creating Inexhaustible Armor requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Chemical solution from a Construct • [Hide] Skin from a Fey • [Hide] Plates • [Organ] Heart from a Gorgon
itemtemplate.source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 388 (Third Party)

itemtemplate.name: Injector's %name%
itemtemplate.text:
This crossbow is covered in metal plating, decorative and refined pointed metal tips along an oak wood body, and foregrip. The barrel and limb are reinforced with the steel plates from a construct, with a stained leather grip made from a monster's hide. Its hair strung bowstring and leather fasteners hold a series of syringes in place. The crossbow's stock has a series of various tubes extruding from it that connect to an alchemical chamber on the side of the weapon. A mechanical wheel feeds the darts into place upon filling them, auto-loading the crossbow for easy firing. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic crossbow. This crossbow ignores the Loading property, and you don't need a free hand to load a piece of ammunition into it. Once per turn when you hit a creature with a ranged attack using this crossbow, you can apply one of the following poisons.
• Virulent. The target takes an extra 2d6 Poison damage. • Weakening. The target must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is Weakened until the start of your next turn. • Immobilizing. The target must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it is Immobilized until the start of your next turn.
Crafting. Creating an Injector Crossbow requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Chemical Solution • [Hair] Hair • [Hide] Plates • [Hide] Skin • [Natural Weapons] Needles from an Injector
itemtemplate.source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 388 (Third Party)

itemtemplate.name: Monster Hunter's %name% +1
itemtemplate.text:
These weapons are carved from bark, with a core of magical sap, and decorated with leaves from magical plants. Their hilts and shafts are bound in hair from a fey creature. This magic weapon channels the natural magic found in the elements of nature. While holding this magic weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Ranger spells. In addition, you can use the weapon as a Spellcasting Focus for your Ranger spells. When you hit with an attack using this weapon, you can expend a Ranger spell slot to cast Hunter's Mark on the target as part of the same action used to make the attack. When you cast Hunter's Mark in this way it does not require Concentration. Additionally, the spell lasts for one minute or until the target dies or you cast Hunter's Mark again using either the weapon or otherwise.
Crafting. Creating a Monster Hunter's Weapon requires a Workshop and the following Components of rarity equal to the item's rarity:
• [Animus] Any Animus • [Fluid] Sap • [Hair] Hair from a Fey • [Hair] Leaves • [Hide] Bark
itemtemplate.source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 390 (Third Party)

itemtemplate.name: Necromancer's %name%
itemtemplate.text:
This suit of armor is constructed from the bones of the dead and outfitted over black woven fabric. The armor has two skulls as pauldrons upon the shoulders, a reinforced spine, and a rib cage that covers the front, and the entire structure is ornately decorated with the fangs of fallen beasts. The bones are magically imbued with otherworldly energy, powered by a powerful undead animus. While attuned to this armor, you are proficient with this armor even if you lack proficiency with light armor. While you are within 30 feet of an Undead creature under your control, you gain Resistance to all damage except Radiant. However, each time you take damage, choose an Undead creature under your control within 30 feet of you. That creature takes the same amount of damage, which can't be reduced or prevented in any way.
Crafting. Creating Necromancer's Armor requires a Rare Workshop and the following Rare Components:
• [Animus] Undead Animus • [Bones] Ribs • [Bones] Skull • [Bones] Spine • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor • [Natural Weapon] Teeth
itemtemplate.source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 383 (Third Party)

itemtemplate.name: %name% Between Worlds
itemtemplate.text:
This otherworldly blade is made from starmetal steel; a potent alloy produced by combining iron with carbon extracted from the bones of powerful aberrant creatures. During the forging process, the blade is quenched in the spinal fluids of a Far Dweller to draw out extraplanar forces. The resulting metal has an octarine sheen that reflects possible worlds and other realities. The grip and crossguard are decorated with the barbs and leather of a Warp Marauder, and the pommel is set with a delerium crystal containing the eldritch essence of a Far Dweller that powers the weapon's magic. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made using this magic weapon. Once per turn when you score a Critical Hit or reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points using this weapon, immediately after the attack you can teleport to an unoccupied space within 120 feet you can see. Additionally, once per turn when you teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of another creature while wielding this weapon, you can make one weapon attack against that creature with this weapon as part of the same action or Bonus Action made to teleport. While holding the blade, you can use a Magic action to cast Dimension Door. Once you do, you must finish a Short or Long Rest before you can use this feature again.
Curse. You have Disadvantage on saving throws against any spell or other effect which would forcibly teleport you or send you to another plane of existence.
Crafting. Creating a Sword Between Worlds requires a Very Rare Workshop and the following Very Rare Components:
• [Animus] Aberration Animus • [Bones] Skull, Spine, or Ribs from an Aberration. • [Fluid] Contaminated Ichor from a Far Dweller • [Hide] Skin from an Aberration • [Natural Weapon] Tentacles from a Warp Marauder
itemtemplate.source: Pluto Jackson's Monsters of Drakkenheim p. 384 (Third Party)
